title: 'Things to come': Mahua posts old photo of B'desh arresting ex-poll chief; BJP reacts
content: TMC leader Mahua Moitra sparked controversy by comparing India's election process to Bangladesh's, drawing sharp criticism from the BJP. Meanwhile, Rahul Gandhi and other Congress leaders voiced concerns over the Election Commission's voter roll revision exercise, alleging it could disenfranchise legitimate voters and calling it a "sinister attempt to destroy Democracy."

title: Delhi car blast probe: Al-Falah University ‘raked in’ Rs 415cr from fees; new details emerge
content: Enforcement Directorate arrested Al-Falah group chairman Jawad Siddiqui.  Crores were allegedly siphoned off to family-linked companies.  Contracts for construction and catering were awarded to businesses owned by his wife and children.  The arrest follows a probe into financial irregularities and fraudulent practices.  The agency seized cash and digital devices during searches.

title: 'Will be risky': Hardik, Bumrah to miss ODIs against South Africa
content: All-rounder Hardik Pandya is unlikely to feature in the upcoming ODI series against South Africa as he focuses on recovering from a quadriceps injury ahead of the T20 World Cup. Jasprit Bumrah is also expected to be rested from the ODI matches due to workload management, with the focus shifting to T20Is until the next IPL.

title: Bhopal: Over a dozen masked men vandalize cafe with no intention to loot; probe on
content: Masked assailants stormed a Bhopal café, vandalizing furniture with swords and sticks in a swift, violent attack. CCTV footage of the incident has gone viral. Police are investigating the incident, suspecting personal enmity as the motive behind the unprovoked destruction.

title: How Cloudflare outage may have cost financial service brokers $1.6 bn
content: A three-hour Cloudflare outage on November 18 disrupted numerous tech and finance websites, potentially costing forex and CFD brokers an estimated $1.58 billion in lost trading volume. The disruption, caused by a bug in a configuration file, impacted firms like Monaxa and FXPro, highlighting their heavy reliance on Cloudflare for both content delivery and cybersecurity.

title: ‘Subject close to heart’: PM Modi hails farming sector reforms
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi envisioned India as a global natural farming hub, highlighting a significant transformation in the agriculture sector over the past decade. He noted agricultural exports have nearly doubled, with youth increasingly embracing farming as a modern career.  The PM lauded Tamil Nadu farmers for their courage and innovation at a recent summit.

title: Jaishankar opens two new consulates in Russia; hails Delhi-Moscow ties
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday inaugurated two new Consulates General in Russia, Yekaterinburg and Kazan. This move marks a significant step in deepening India and Russia bilateral ties. The new missions will foster economic, technological, and scientific cooperation. They will also support the large Indian community residing in Russia.

title: Gemini 3 launch: Musk, Sam Altman praise AI model; Tesla CEO warns
content: Elon Musk has congratulated Google CEO Sundar Pichai and DeepMind's Demis Hassabis on the launch of Gemini 3.  Musk's praise came with a competitive edge, hinting at xAI's upcoming Grok 4.20.  Gemini 3 is Google's most advanced AI model, claiming top benchmark rankings.  Grok 4.1 had briefly held the top spot before Gemini 3's release.  Google is rapidly integrating Gemini 3 across its products, including Search.  This marks a significant development in the ongoing AI race between major tech companies.

title: Not Sachin, Kohli, or Dravid - Shai Hope becomes 1st batter to achieve this rare feat
content: Shai Hope's brilliant unbeaten 109 in a rain-shortened ODI against New Zealand wasn't enough as the hosts secured a five-wicket victory. Hope's century, his first against New Zealand, saw him equal Brian Lara's 19 ODI hundreds and become the first to score centuries against all Test-playing nations. He also surpassed 6,000 ODI runs.

title: Kolkata: Woman receives bullet injury in Howrah housing complex; husband detained
content: A woman was injured by a bullet grazed her neck inside a residential complex in Howrah's Shibpur area. Her husband claims the incident was accidental while cleaning his licensed firearm. Police are investigating the husband's statement and the circumstances of the firing.

title: PSL in trouble! Team owner who tore up notice, now threatens legal action on league
content: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen publicly claims the franchise is being excluded from the PSL's valuation and renewal process, citing a lack of response from league management. Tareen stated that despite multiple attempts through formal and legal channels, the team has received no communication, prompting a warning of potential legal action if the impasse continues.

title: Tech firm whose founder beat Musk as world's richest for a day loses 30% market value
content: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after Oracle's stock surged on a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and pushing Ellison down the rankings. Musk has since reclaimed his top spot, driven by strong performance in Tesla and SpaceX.

title: Verdict in absentia, empathy in short supply: Reading B'desh through its Hasina coverage
content: Bangladeshi media largely avoids sharp criticism following Sheikh Hasina's death sentence, instead adopting a matter-of-fact tone. Coverage reveals little empathy for Hasina, with minimal interrogation of her claims of a rigged tribunal. The nation's newspapers are discussing her downfall as a settled matter, shifting focus to the political vacuum she leaves behind.

title: ED attaches 9 luxury Dubai properties worth Rs 51.7 cr; linked to bank fraud
content: The Enforcement Directorate has seized nine luxury properties in Dubai valued at over Rs 51 crore. These assets are linked to a massive Rs 1,266 crore fraud against the State Bank of India. The fraud allegedly involves Advantage Overseas Private Limited and its owner Shrikant Bhasi. Funds were siphoned off through shell companies and used to acquire these foreign assets.

title: 28 people died since SIR began: Mamata; Bengal CM claims 'inhuman' pressure on workers
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed deep concern over the death of a Booth Level Officer in Jalpaiguri, attributing it to "unbearable pressure" from the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls.

title: LiAngelo Ball turns rapper: 'Tweaker' hits platinum, shock crossover
content: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.

title: NBA trade rumor: Rockets eye $118M Mavericks star in blockbuster deal
content: Houston Rockets, surprisingly strong early, are exploring a blockbuster trade for Kyrie Irving to fill the void left by Fred VanVleet's season-ending injury. This move would reunite Irving with Kevin Durant, a partnership that previously generated significant excitement. The proposed deal involves trading VanVleet and Dorian Finney-Smith for Irving, offering Houston a veteran playmaker and elite scorer.

title: Gisele Bündchen says focusing on Tom Brady’s career took personal toll
content: Shannon Sharpe's podcast comments resurfaced, suggesting emotional fulfillment, not wealth, may have driven Gisele Bündchen's divorce from Tom Brady. Sharpe theorized that despite Brady's fortune, unmet needs for time and attention could have eroded their 13-year marriage. This perspective continues to resonate, highlighting that financial security alone cannot sustain relationships under pressure.

title: 'Venomous rhetoric': Citizens pen letter against Rahul; accuse Cong of making unsubstantiated claims
content: A group of 272 eminent citizens, including retired judges, bureaucrats, and military officers, have penned an open letter criticizing Rahul Gandhi and the Congress for allegedly undermining constitutional bodies, particularly the Election Commission. The letter accuses the opposition of baseless rhetoric and "systematic and conspiratorial attacks" against the ECI, urging civil society to support the institution.

title: IIT Bombay vs IIT Madras: Which institute is home to higher number of female students?
content: India’s IITs have long struggled with low female enrolment, prompting the introduction of supernumerary seats from 2018 to address the widening gender gap. As gender diversity becomes a key priority, fresh data reveals that IIT Bombay hosts 1,677 women compared to IIT Madras’s 1,587. The comparison underscores both progress and the persistent structural barriers limiting girls’ entry into engineering.

title: ICC rankings: Rohit Sharma's reign ends! NZ star becomes World No1 ODI batter
content: Daryl Mitchell has dethroned Rohit Sharma to become the world's top ODI batsman, a historic feat for New Zealand.  This shift highlights significant movements across all formats, with Pakistan's players climbing ODI rankings and India's Jasprit Bumrah maintaining his Test bowling supremacy.  South Africa's Temba Bavuma also entered the top five Test batters.

title: Happy International Men's Day: 75+ messages, wishes, greetings and quotes
content: International Men's Day 2025 is being celebrated to recognize men's diverse strengths, contributions, and values in families, communities, and society. The occasion emphasizes encouraging positive role models, promoting gender equality, and supporting men's mental well-being. Heartfelt messages, wishes, and quotes are shared to express gratitude, encouragement, and recognition for men's invaluable presence and impact.

title: Aishwarya Rai shares stage with PM Modi, Sachin at Sai centenary; speech praised - video
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan joined Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other dignitaries at Sri Sathya Sai Baba's birth centenary celebrations in Puttaparthi.  She delivered a powerful address emphasizing humanity, love, and unity, stating there is only one caste: humanity. Her message resonated with the crowd, highlighting Sai Baba's enduring legacy of compassion and service.

title: India vs China: Who sends more engineering students to the US?
content: India has surged past China in sending engineering students to the US, a significant shift reshaping America's STEM landscape. With nearly twice as many Indian engineering students as Chinese, India now dominates this critical field, influencing the future technical workforce. This trend highlights India's focused technical mobility versus China's diversified academic outflow.

title: Trump sanctions a 'crude' shock! Russia oil to India drops by 66%
content: US sanctions on Russian oil giants Rosneft and Lukoil have significantly impacted India's crude imports, with shipments plummeting by 66% in November. Refineries are now wary of US penalties, leading to reduced new orders and expedited existing ones. This shift forces Russian exporters to adopt more opaque shipping methods to navigate sanctions.

title: Haryana horror: Dancer slapped, dragged and hit with stick at wedding - act caught on cam
content: A dancer was assaulted at a pre-wedding event in Nuh, Haryana, after objecting to inappropriate behavior from a groom's relative. The performer, Payal Choudhary, was attacked on stage when she pushed away a man's hand holding currency notes. The assault escalated, with multiple individuals joining in, and other dancers and an intervener were also beaten.

title: Ind vs SA: Gautam Gambhir to be removed as head coach? Sourav Ganguly drops blunt verdict
content: Sourav Ganguly clarified Eden Gardens' pitch preparation, stating BCCI curators took charge four days prior to the India-South Africa Test. He admitted the surface wasn't ideal for the Indian batting lineup. Curator Sujan Mukherjee confirmed he prepared the wicket as per team management's request, with Gautam Gambhir reportedly wanting such a pitch.

title: Watch: Rohini Acharya slams journalist for saying 'married daughters' remark; video viral
content: Rohini Acharya, daughter of Lalu Prasad, strongly criticized a journalist's remark that married daughters shouldn't spend much time at their parents' home. She also condemned accusations of profiting from her kidney donation to her father, urging critics to donate themselves instead.

title: IND vs SA: 'Leave your ego in the dressing room'- Gavaskar tears into India’s approach
content: Following India's Test defeat to South Africa, Sunil Gavaskar urged management and selectors to prioritize proven domestic performers over limited-overs all-rounders. He stressed Test cricket demands specialists, patience, and discipline, not players selected on ego or short-term form. Gavaskar highlighted the need for batters accustomed to home conditions and warned against conflating limited-overs needs with Test expectations.

title: 'Oh, we’re making a lot of progress, huh?’: Trump’s exchange with Palestinian journalist — watch
content: US President Donald Trump claimed Palestinians “liked” him and were “doing well” while speaking alongside Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman at the White House. He also said Gaza was now “much safer.” His remarks came as Hamas rejected a UN-backed US resolution based on Trump’s 20-point Gaza peace plan.

title: 'Suicide haram in Islam': Owaisi reacts to Delhi blast bomber's video; slams 'martyrdom' talk
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday condemned a video of Delhi blast accused Umar Nabi justifying suicide bombings, stating suicide is haram in Islam and killing innocents is a grave sin. Owaisi also questioned Union Home Minister Amit Shah about the attack's detection, asking about the origin of the group.

title: Andhra Pradesh: PM Modi offers prayers at Sri Sathya Sai Baba’s Mahasamadhi — video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Puttaparthi, Andhra Pradesh, to honor spiritual leader Sri Sathya Sai Baba's birth centenary. He paid homage at the Mahasamadhi, released a commemorative coin and postal stamps, and later traveled to Coimbatore to inaugurate the South India Natural Farming Summit and release the 21st installment of PM-KISAN.

title: LiAngelo Ball makes Platinum history with Drake-assisted hit 'Tweaker'
content: Jamal Khashoggi's widow, Hanan Elatr Khashoggi, has demanded a personal apology and compensation from Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who recently called the journalist's killing a "huge mistake." She expressed pain over the Crown Prince's reception in Washington, urging the US to prioritize human rights over deals with Riyadh. Khashoggi was murdered in 2018 at the Saudi consulate in Istanbul.

title: 5 health red flags men can’t afford to ignore this international men’s day
content: Men often dismiss crucial health signals, leading to delayed diagnoses. This International Men's Day, doctors urge attention to five key red flags: unusual pelvic/testicular changes, chest discomfort, unmonitored blood pressure/diabetes, altered bowel habits, and mental health struggles. Early detection is vital for better outcomes, especially as chronic diseases affect younger men.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill travels to Guwahati; management to take late call on participation
content: India's Test captain Shubman Gill is set to join the team in Guwahati for the second Test against South Africa, commencing November 22. Despite a neck injury sustained during the Kolkata Test, Gill's condition has improved, and the BCCI medical team has cleared his travel.

title: Ashes: Why Glenn McGrath was dropped from commentary panel; Perth Test from Nov 21
content: Cricket icon Glenn McGrath has been dropped from the ABC's Ashes commentary team due to a new commercial deal with betting firm Bet365. The broadcaster adheres to strict rules against such affiliations. This move follows a similar situation with Mitchell Johnson and occurs amidst increasing concerns about gambling's impact on Australian sports.

title: Thaw in ties? Musk at Trump's dinner with Saudi prince; video shows prez giving him brief tap
content: Elon Musk's appearance at a White House dinner with President Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman suggests a potential thawing of their recent feud. This comes after Musk publicly criticized Trump and hinted at his involvement in the Jeffrey Epstein scandal, a stark contrast to his earlier support.

title: Running 10+, 15+ year-old vehicle? Fitness test fees updated: Prices, details
content: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has revised vehicle fitness test fees with a new age-based structure, lowering the threshold for higher charges to 10 years. Fees now increase across three age brackets: 10-15 years, 15-20 years, and over 20 years, impacting all vehicle categories.

title: Who is Dak Prescott’s fiancée? Meet Sarah Jane Ramos and her $1M ring
content: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott and fiancée Sarah Jane Ramos are embracing parenthood with their two daughters, Margaret Jane Rose and Aurora Rayne. Ramos, a former wine industry professional with a passion for hockey, has been a steadfast partner through Prescott's career highs and personal milestones. Their growing family signifies a strong bond and shared commitment.

title: NASA to unveil rare imagery of interstellar comet 3I ATLAS on 19 November 2025
content: NASA is set to unveil stunning new images of the rare interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, a visitor from another star system. Discovered earlier this year, this marks only the third such object observed in our solar system. The live event will offer insights into its journey and composition, providing a unique glimpse into distant cosmic environments.

title: Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha announce their baby boy's name
content: Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha have revealed the name of their newborn son, Neer, nearly a month after his birth. The couple shared a tender photo and a poetic explanation for the name, which means 'pure, divine, limitless.' Celebrities and fans have sent warm wishes following the announcement.

title: Men Posing As Government Officials Flee With Rs 7 Crore In Bengaluru
content: Unidentified men posing as central government officials intercepted a cash van here and allegedly fled with about Rs 7 crore on Wednesday, police said.

title: 2 'Tala-Chaabi' Gang Members Arrested In Delhi In Rs 1.5 Crore Burglary Case
content: Two alleged members of the 'tala-chaabi' gang, who pose as key-makers and survey houses locked for several days before breaking in, have been arrested in a Rs 1.5 crore burglary case in Delhi's Shahdara, police said on Wednesday.

title: 4 UP Cops Suspended Over Video Showing Collusion With Liquor Smugglers
content: Four police personnel, including an outpost in-charge, were suspended on Wednesday after the screenshots and videos alleging their collusion with liquor smugglers in the Revati area here went viral on social media, officials said.

title: UK Says "Military Options Ready" If Russian Spy Ship Becomes A Threat
content: British defence minister John Healey said on Wednesday that "military options" are ready should the Russian spy ship Yantar become a threat, after the vessel directed lasers at British pilots sent to monitor it.

title: Anmol Bishnoi Used Fake Passport To Enter US, Under The Name Bhanu Pratap
content: Anmol Bishnoi, a key accused in the murders of former Maharashtra minister Baba Siddique and singer Sidhu Moosewala, had got a fake passport made under the name Bhanu Pratap and had used that to illegally enter the US, officials said.

title: Who Was Tech Shankar, Maoist Leader And IED Expert Killed In Security Op
content: Security forces this week killed one of the most sought-after Maoist operatives in the country: Meturi Jokha Rao, better known within the organisation as Tech Shankar, in the dense forests of Maredumilli in Andhra Pradesh.

title: NASA To Release New Photos Of Interstellar Object 3I/ATLAS
content: NASA is set on Wednesday to release new images of an interstellar object called 3I/ATLAS that astronomers have determined is a comet probably even older than our solar system.

title: Al Falah Chief 'Dishonestly' Made Rs 415 Crore From Students: Probe Agency
content: Seeking custody of Al Falah group chairperson Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui in a money laundering case, the ED has told a Delhi court that he received at least Rs 415 crore "generated dishonestly" from students of educational institutes run by the group.

title: Suicide Bomber Umar Nabi's Propaganda Video Removed From All Meta Platforms
content: A video recorded by the suicide bomber before the attack near Delhi's Red Fort has been taken down from all platforms under Meta, the company owned by Mark Zuckerberg said. Meta said the video goes against the terms and rules of Meta's platforms.

title: Girl With Mental Health Issues Raped Multiple Times: UP Police
content: A mentally challenged minor girl was allegedly raped multiple times in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur, police said.

title: What Are Epstein Files? Court Records, Emails, That Trump Wants To Release
content: US President Donald Trump has called on House Republicans to release government documents related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. This comes after the 79-year-old showed resistance for months.

title: Explained: Who Did What In White Collar Terror Module Behind Delhi Blast
content: More details about how the white collar terror module operated has emerged, over a week after the Jaish-e-Mohammed-linked module in Haryana's Faridabad launched a suicide car bomb attack near Delhi's Red Fort.

title: Close Yunus Aide Arrives In India Days After Sheikh Hasina's Death Sentence
content: Amid strained ties, Bangladesh's National Security Adviser (NSA) Khalilur Rahman, a close aide of interim government chief Muhammad Yunus, is visiting India to participate in a regional security conclave.

title: 'Can't Rule Out War With India': Pak Minister Says Country On 'Full Alert'
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif on Tuesday warned that Islamabad cannot discount the possibility of an "all-out war" with India, saying the country remains on "full alert" amid escalating regional tensions.

title: IED Expert Tech Shankar Among 7 Maoists Killed In Andhra, Day After Madvi Hidma
content: Seven more Maoists, including key IED expert Tech Shankar, were killed on Wednesday in an encounter in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri Sitharama Raju district, a day after top Maoist leader Madvi Hidma was gunned down in an exchange of fire

title: Agentic AI, A System That Acts Autonomously, Is The New Tech Buzzword
content: For technology adopters looking for the next big thing, "agentic AI" is the future. At least, that's what the marketing pitches and tech industry T-shirts say.

title: Leaving For School, 18-Year-Old Stabbed To Death By Neighbour In Tamil Nadu
content: A Class 12 student has been stabbed to death outside her house in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram district by her neighbour, allegedly because she had been avoiding him and refused to speak to him.

title: Trump Administration Proposes Denying Green Cards If You Use Government Aid
content: The United States is planning to tighten rules for immigrants seeking permanent residency in America. The Donald Trump administration's proposed change targets the "public charge" rule, which has been in place since December 2022.

title: Exclusive - RJD Comeback Not Possible Until 'Jungle Raj' Issue Is There: Prashant Kishor
content: Jan Suraaj Party chief Prashant Kishor spoke to NDTV, days after his party drew a blank in the Bihar Assembly elections.

title: On Camera, 9-Year-Old Boy Killed As Bus Uncontrollably Rolls Onto Platform
content: A nine-year-old boy was killed, and at least four others were injured after a state transport bus rolled onto the passenger platform at the Sinnar bus stand in Maharashtra's Nashik district on Thursday.

title: A.P. Rythu Sangham seeks market support for banana, maize farmers
content: It urges the government that an investment assistance of ₹20,000 per year being provided to farmers should also be extended to those cultivating on lease

title: Govt. completes half term amid tussle over power sharing and suspense of Cabinet reshuffle
content: Siddaramaiah is expected to break Devaraj Urs's record as the longest-serving Chief Minister of Karnataka if he continues in office till Budget

title: BJP accuses Left parties, ‘urban naxals’ of shielding Maoists
content: Maintenance of internal security is among the top priorities of the Narendra Modi government, says BJP spokesperson

title: Authorities begin exercise of inspecting lockers of doctors, medical staff in hospitals of Jammu and Kashmir
content: As part of the process, the authorities in Shopian and Kulgam districts, in south Kashmir, inspected the lockers of doctors and medical staff at various hospitals, an officials said

title: Western India heritage to take centre stage at Bharatiya Kala Mahotsav in Hyderabad
content: The nine-day festival will showcase traditions from Gujarat, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Goa, Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu

title: Sathya Sai Baba’s teachings continue to guide millions worldwide, say Sachin Tendulkar, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan
content: It reflects the global growth of the Sathya Sai movement, says the cricket icon; the role of Baba’s educational and healthcare institutions in providing free service is exemplary, observes the actor

title: Setback for Ghulam Nabi Azad's party as two former Ministers among leaders back in Congress
content: Former Members of Legislative Council (MLCs) Subash Gupta and Brij Mohan Sharma also rejoined Congress at a function organised to mark the 108th birth anniversary of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi

title: ICMR approves ₹6.2 crore for kidney research in Uddanam
content: Under the project, titled ‘Srikakulam Kidney Research Project’, the health department will identify individuals who are likely to develop kidney disease within a year or two and will provide early treatment to them; this will be done through tests

title: Minister Duraimurugan opens rejuvenated twin lakes near Katpadi
content: As part of restoration work, two lakes were desilted to the original depth of six metres. The lakes were also deepened to store additional rainwater during monsoon.

title: UDF delegation to highlight pilgrim ‘woes’ at Sabarimala
content: Law enforcers fail in regulating crowd, causing a potentially disastrous pile-up of pilgrims far beyond the holding capacity of Sabarimala, says Satheesan

title: YSRCP leaders blame MLA Balakrishna for attack on party office in Hindupur
content: The attackers were not stopped despite the presence of police and false cases were foisted upon YSRCP cadres, allege party’s women leaders

title: Gujarat State Forest and Environment Minister hails return of long-extinct tiger to forest
content: The settling of the tiger has prompted State Forest and Environment Minister Arjun Modhwadia to announce that Gujarat has become the abode of three big cats- the lion, leopard, and tiger

title: BJP will sweep 2026 Assam Assembly polls, Gogoi will then fight elections in Pakistan: Himanta
content: He (Gaurav Gogoi) will hundred per cent lose the polls in Assam, and then he can contest the elections in Pakistan, says Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: CPI(M) demands judicial probe into Maredumilli encounters in Andhra Pradesh
content: Party State secretary Srinivasa Rao condemns what he terms as extra-judicial killings and police harassment

title: VVPAT not mandatory for local body polls, technically not feasible: State Election Commission to Bombay High Court
content: The commission, in its affidavit, said local body Acts, which govern municipal elections, do not mandate the use of VVPAT

title: Delhi blast: All Kashmiris being looked at with suspicion, says Omar Abdullah
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said he also thinks twice before taking out his vehicle, bearing Jammu and Kashmir registration, in the national capital

title: Miscreants posing as IT officials rob ₹7 crore from ATM cash van in Bengaluru
content: Special teams have been formed to launch a massive manhunt to track down the accused. The police have examined over 50 CCTV camera recordings and have alerted checkpoints across various routes.

title: Congress has become a burden, taking down allies: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Congress has become such a burden that whichever party it joins, that party sinks. Wherever Rahul Gandhi goes, it is a disaster

title: Jaishankar inaugurates two new Indian consulates in Russia
content: Expanding its diplomatic footprint in Russia, India opened the new Consulates General in the cities of Yekaterinburg and Kazan

title: Interview: ‘Karnataka is India’s services export powerhouse, Bengaluru the main engine’
content: ‘But the urban grind — endless commutes, gridlocked traffic, strained utilities, and crumbling civic backbone — inflate delivery costs and drag down decision-making speed’

title: 272 eminent citizens accuse Opposition of ‘tarnishing’ Election Commission with ‘unsubstantiated accusations’
content: Open letter by retired judges, officials, and veterans alleges a “systematic attempt” to undermine EC credibility

title: L-G admits discontent in Ladakh over ‘imbalanced’ representation in talks with Centre
content: L-G Kavinder Gupta said the Leh Apex Body (LAB) and Kargil Democratic Alliance (KDA) had prepared a 29-page draft proposal of their demands as a follow-up to the last meeting with the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) sub-committee.

title: T.N. government’s scholarship scheme helps transwoman realise her dream of studying abroad
content: S. Daksha Pradhayeni, a native of Cuddalore, will join the University of Salford in England in June 2026 to pursue a Master of Science in Project Management

title: Kerala Police intensify manhunt for prime suspects in teenager’s murder
content: The investigation team has not ruled out the possibility that the gang may have fled across the State border into Tamil Nadu

title: Top 3 of CFP unchanged; Tide drop, UGA to No. 4
content: Ohio State, Indiana and Texas A&M remained the top three teams in the latest College Football Playoff rankings, while Alabama dropped six spots to No. 10 and was replaced by Georgia at No. 4.

title: Lakers score 140 in LeBron's historic season debut
content: Lakers star LeBron James made his season debut against the Jazz, taking the court to begin an NBA-record 23rd season.

title: Federer aces election to International Tennis HOF
content: Roger Federer has been elected to the International Tennis Hall of Fame in his first year of eligibility. TV announcer and journalist Mary Carillo was selected in the contributor category.

title: Chase's 1-game suspension for spitting upheld
content: Ja'Marr Chase's one-game suspension for spitting on Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey was upheld Tuesday, meaning the star Bengals receiver will not play Sunday against the Patriots.

title: After big win, Poch objects to 'regular' player talk
content: Mauricio Pochettino dismissed the idea of the United States having "regular players" after an alternate starting lineup thrashed Uruguay 5-1 on Tuesday in Tampa.

title: Pope rues 'poorly coached' Kentucky after blowout
content: Kentucky coach Mark Pope took responsibility for the Wildcats' struggles Tuesday night, saying his team is "completely discombobulated" after an 83-66 loss to Michigan State.

title: Deion: Need more time, but Buffs have 'right man'
content: Deion Sanders, who will post his second losing season in three years in Colorado, insisted he is "the right man" to lead the Buffaloes but said he needs more time.

title: Nico Harrison, Mark Cuban and a 'palace coup': Inside a bitter feud for control in Dallas
content: Here's what led to the end of Nico Harrison's tenure with the Dallas Mavericks 11 games into the season, and how Mark Cuban was involved.

title: NFL Week 12 buzz: Will Burrow, Daniels return? Who are the hottest coaching candidates?
content: Will Joe Burrow and Jayden Daniels play again this season? Are the Vikings worried about J.J. McCarthy? And which coaches are on the hot seat? Here's what we're hearing.

title: Miller's new NFL mock draft: 32 first-round pick predictions -- and two trades -- five months out
content: How early could Ty Simpson go? What about Makai Lemon, David Bailey and Mansoor Delane? Let's project Round 1 of the 2026 draft -- plus two trades.

title: Can Colts RB Jonathan Taylor win MVP? Here's how he stacks up against four QB candidates
content: Matthew Stafford is now the favorite to win MVP, but can he hold off Drake Maye, Josh Allen, Patrick Mahomes and Taylor?

title: What Lakers insiders are monitoring as LeBron James makes his unprecedented return
content: As James begins his record-setting 23rd season in the NBA, here are the four biggest questions to answer.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Who provides the most stealth help for all 30 teams?
content: Insiders break down this week's power rankings, including who is the most important role player for every team.

title: Wetzel: Was Al Davis right about Lane Kiffin?
content: In different circumstances, Kiffin could -- maybe even should -- leave Ole Miss. But not these circumstances.

title: Statement win over Uruguay shows the USMNT has come a long way in 16 months
content: Sixteen months ago, the U.S. men's national team hit rock bottom, losing 1-0 to Uruguay to seal its group-stage elimination from the 2024 Copa America. Now things are very different.

title: How a baseball behemoth plans to get ... better? 3 offseason questions as Dodgers eye three-peat
content: L.A.'s blueprint to bolster a two-time defending champion will be among MLB's biggest stories this winter.

title: Woo's debut 2026 mock draft: Where Peterson, Dybantsa, Boozer could land
content: Early injuries scattering the No. 1 pick race? Only two guards in the top 10? Let's project all 30 picks for the 2026 first round.

title: Ranking men's basketball Freshman of the Year contenders: Who is No. 1?
content: AJ Dybantsa and Cameron Boozer have cases for the strongest season so far. Here's who else is in the running.

title: Women's college basketball Power Rankings: TCU in, Duke out, more movers
content: The first five teams hold steady while Oklahoma and Michigan make big jumps and TCU enters the top 16.

title: Ranked: All 64 national teams that can still win the 2026 World Cup after latest eliminations
content: There are still 64 national teams that can win the FIFA World Cup next summer. Let's go through them all and rank where they stand.

title: Bad Bunny, big stage: How will 2026 halftime stack up with the most searched Super Bowl shows?
content: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl set is drawing early buzz, but search data shows which halftime shows have truly stood the test of time.

title: Navy's uniforms for 2025 Army-Navy game pay homage to USS Constitution
content: The uniform draws inspiration from the ship, which was one of the six original frigates of the U.S. Navy.

title: Individual rankings for each position in Week 12
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Why Haney is in an unusual spot heading into the Norman fight
content: Devin Haney is only 26, a pound-for-pound talent and unbeaten. So, why is he facing a crossroads fight against Brian Norman Jr.?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona's Lewandowski wanted by AC Milan
content: AC Milan have made veteran Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski a target. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Allegations of financial mismanagement in BJP-controlled cooperative society surface amid Kerala local body poll campaign
content: Report of Cooperative department ordering office-bearers of BJP-controlled Peringammala Labour Contract Cooperative Society to pay a total of ₹4.16 crore to make up for society’s losses surface in public domain

title: Sangita Jindal inaugurates rest house for truck drivers in Toranagallu, launches health and road safety initiative through Hamraahi project
content: The rest house offers world-class facilities for truck drivers, including 3 washing machines, two dedicated wash-and-dry areas, a TV hall for entertainment, fully air-conditioned rooms, and on-site staff assistance

title: Anmol Bishnoi, gangster Lawrence’s brother, arrested by NIA in Delhi
content: Absconding since 2022, U.S.-based Anmol is the 19th accused to be arrested for his involvement in the terror-syndicate led by his jailed brother, Lawrence Bishnoi

title: Opposition UDF ‘chargesheet’ portrays Kerala as a State in decline under nearly a decade of LDF rule
content: V.D. Satheesan says UDF will expose LDF’s ‘smokescreen of lies’ about the State’s development, including tall claims about eradicating extreme poverty, in doorstep conversations and town hall meetings with voters

title: Mamata blames ECI for Jalpaiguri BLO’s death; BJP hits back, family cites rising workload
content: The Chief Minister claimed the deceased — an anganwadi worker engaged as a BLO — died by suicide due to the "unbearable pressure"

title: Supreme Court calls for uniform national mechanism for organ transplantation, after-care
content: Bench refers to how organ donors, many a time, were left in the lurch following transplantations without any follow-up medical care

title: Maoists wanted to use Andhra cities for refuge and regroup, says ADGP Mahesh Laddha
content: Police will achieve the target of eliminating left-wing extremism by March 2026 deadline set by the Centre, says Intelligence ADGP Mahesh Chandra Laddha

title: SC grants interim bail to Jyoti Jagtap in Bhima-Koregaon case
content: Supreme Court allows temporary relief to activist after five years in custody; appeal challenges Bombay HC’s 2022 order under UAPA

title: Air India lobbies to use airspace over China's Xinjiang as financial woes mount
content: Pakistan airspace closure has hit Air India hard, document shows; Airline pushing for alternate route clearance over Xinjiang

title: RG Kar case: Can't pass 'blanket orders' protecting doctors involved in protests, says Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court emphasises the need for local oversight in monitoring protests by doctors, rejecting broad protections amid ongoing legal challenges and public outcry following the tragic death of a trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College

title: Alleged death threat to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Facebook sparks political row
content: Alleged comment referred to the assassination of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi, stating that ‘this world, which killed a good man like Rajiv Gandhi, can do that as well’

title: Watch: Names of children killed in Gaza read out in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Manaveeyam Veedhi in Thiruvananthapuram turned into a space of remembrance on November 16. People gathered on the cultural street to read out the names of children killed in Gaza, making sure their identities were not lost in numbers. The event, called The Names of Gaza and organised by the Chinta Ravi Foundation, brought together activists, civil society members and ordinary citizens.

title: Supreme Court strikes down provisions of Tribunal Reforms Act, directs Govt to establish National Tribunal Commission
content: SC says Centre ‘tweaked’ same provisions of a struck-down ordinance and reproduced it in Tribunal Reforms Act

title: PM Modi offers prayers at Saibaba's Maha Samadhi in A.P.’s Puttaparthi
content: Thousands of devotees from across India and abroad have gathered to mark the historic occasion, with elaborate arrangements put in place by the Trust and district administration

title: Translocated elephant ‘Radhakrishnan’ found dead in Tirunelveli’s Kalakkad-Mundanthurai Tiger Reserve
content: The tusker had been translocated to the KMTR two weeks ago, where it was released in the Upper Gothaiyar area with a radio collar

title: CJI lists Kerala Govt, IUML pleas to defer SIR in Kerala for hearing on November 21
content: Kerala argues that conducting the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls (SIR) concurrently with the local body elections would overwhelm available personnel and hinder essential government functions

title: Kerala district administrations seek volunteers for SIR of electoral rolls amid pressure on BLOs
content: House-to-house enumeration phase of SIR has been mired in controversy with BLOs, political parties and service organisations complaining that BLOs are overburdened with work on account of operational overlap with upcoming local body elections and pressure to meet unfair deadlines

title: Youth stabs Class 12 schoolgirl to death in Rameswaram
content: On Wednesday morning, while the girl was on her way to school, the accused confronted her near Sethupathi Nagar and stabbed her in the neck, the police said

title: Al Falah University founder Jawed Siddiqui in ED custody for 13 days in money laundering case
content: The ED has alleged that the Al Falah University falsely claimed that it is a UGC recognised university and misrepresented its NAAC status

title: 3-year-old killed, another child injured after school bus runs over students in Kerala’s Idukki
content: After a bus dropped students off in front of the school, they walked towards the back of the vehicle to enter the classroom. Soon, another school bus entered the spot which hit the children and ran over them

title: 'Tally is now 60': Congress after Trump repeats India-Pakistan peace broker claim
content: "I've stopped actually eight wars. Have another one to go with, (Russian President Vladimir) Putin, the U.S. President said in his bilateral meeting with the Saudi Crown Prince

title: Digital arrest fraud: Elderly man from Kerala loses ₹1.51 crore from his bank account
content: Probe underway to track the source of the bank account used to receive the defrauded money by the fraudsters who pretended as enforcement officers

title: YSRCP leaders accuse A.P. govt. of neglecting Hindu Dharma, temples
content: The YSRCP also took objection to the reported insult to Rani Sadasivamurthy, Vice-Chancellor of Sri Venkateswara Veda Vignana Peetham, removing him on what he termed unjust and baseless grounds

title: De-addiction centre in every district to help check drug abuse, says A.P. Minister
content: Pointing out that EAGLE stands for Elite Anti-Narcotics Group for Law Enforcement, the Minister said it brings together various departments such as Police, Excise and Education

title: Seven more Maoists killed in exchange of fire in Maredumilli forests of Andhra Pradesh
content: Top Maoist leader Metturi Joga Rao alias Tech Shankar among those slain, said police; firing is continuing as per latest report

title: New models for inclusive travel and design unveiled at Open Sky, Open Mind Summit and Awards 2025 in Bengaluru
content: OSOM 2025 showcased how airports, technology, and universal design can work together to build an ecosystem where every person, regardless of disability, can navigate the world with dignity and independence

title: Kerala local body polls: How printing industry is reaping big gains as candidates woo voters
content: Trend of posters featuring candidates in cinematic frames seems to have brought in good money for the printing industry. Unlike the past, candidates now prefer printing materials in multiple designs and sizes, offering a business bonanza for creators

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: IUML scrambling to preserve its stronghold in Kottakkal
content: Though it won 21 of the 32 seats the previous election, internal disputes resulted in a party rebel becoming the chairperson, albeit for a brief period, with LDF support

title: Kerala local body polls: RSP at an existential crossroads
content: The previous two elections saw the party virtually eliminated from representation in Assembly. In the 2015 local body elections and the subsequent Assembly polls, the LDF made deep inroads into traditional RSP territory

title: Kerala local body polls: Migration redrawing political map of central Travancore
content: Across multiple local bodies in three central Travancore districts, political parties concede that voter numbers have either stagnated or declined over the past five years. For parties whose social base lies deeply embedded in the regions religious and community networks, this demographic shift has become an existential challenge

title: Two Sri Lanka-bound flights diverted to Thiruvananthapuram airport due to bad weather
content: The Dammam-Colombo flight and the Turkish Airlines flight will depart for their destinations once weather improves in Sri Lanka, say airport officials

title: Allahabad HC sets aside conviction of Mohammad Ilyas in 1996 bus bomb blast case
content: A two-judge Bench comprising Justice Siddharth and Justice Ram Manohar Narayan Mishra vacated the conviction, observing that the prosecution "miserably failed" in proving the charges

title: T.N. CM Stalin accuses Centre of denying Metro Rail projects for Coimbatore, Madurai on flimsy grounds
content: Mr. Stalin said pushing such a political custom, in which BJP-ruled States get Metros for smaller Tier II cities while opposition-ruled States are deprived, is a disgraceful approach

title: What can local bodies expect from the 16th Finance Commission? | Explained
content: What do the 73rd and 74th constitutional amendments mandate? What have multiple State Finance Commission reports recommended? How have Union Finance Commissions failed to bring about substantial changes, especially with respect to performance-linked grants?

title: A lost garden and a forgotten square in Chennai
content: Walking down Badrian’s Garden, which is seeped in history, is something of an adventure today, putting life and limbs at risk

title: The row over Karunanidhi’s ‘Anna way-Periyar way’ remark during 1991 election campaign
content: Although Karunanidhi was quick to clarify his observation made during poll campaign in Coimbatore district on May 15 in 1991, it did not satisfy many.

title: AIADMK cadres realise that SIR is a danger, says DMK MP N.R. Elango
content: He said the AIADMK had supported the SIR without understanding the problems, doing so merely to please the BJP.

title: Toddler run over near Vaniyambadi
content: Unaware of the baby on the carriageway, the driver took the vehicle and the baby was crushed under the wheels.

title: LED lights won’t affect ornaments of Arunachaleswara Temple deities during procession: HR&CE
content: It comes in the wake of a section of devotees and residents in the temple town fearing that LED lighting, which goes for hours, on the idols during procession could have an adverse effect on their ornaments.

title: 90% of adults in Tamil Nadu say they have personally felt the effects of global warming: Yale Climate Opinion maps
content: Tamil Nadu, one of India’s most urbanised and industrialised States, has been facing rising temperatures, erratic rainfall, and frequent extreme weather events.

title: When a policeman casually took a powerful bomb inside police station in Chennai
content: The incident involving ‘tiffin box bomb’ in Tamil Nadu in 1998 is worth recalling in light of the accidental blast of seized explosives at the Nowgam police station in Jammu and Kashmir on November 14, 2025, which led to death of nine persons.

title: Yamuna Boat Tourism Project will offer a green tourism experience with electric-solar boats
content: The project located upstream of the Wazirabad Barrage between Sonia Vihar and Jagatpur, seeks to offer a new green tourism experience

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: the WNBA and WNBPA agreed on a 30-day extension of the current CBA . it remains unclear what the players think of this proposal and whether it moves the needle ahead of the new Nov. 30 deadline . the union did not respond to requests for comment Tuesday night .

title: Early bets for Week 12: Bears to cover at home, Saints to pull off upset among plays
content: the Buffalo Bills (-4.5) visit the Houston Texans as road favorites on "Thursday Night Football" the late window features a matchup of NFC East rivals when the Dallas Cowboys host the Philadelphia Eagles . the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Los Angeles Rams close out the slate on "sunday night football"

title: Let's talk about North Texas -- why the Mean Green is the bet to make in December
content: north Texas is sitting -115 both ways to make or miss the playoff . the committee is reacting to resumes, but not quality wins . UNT has one loss, a 63-36 defensive collapse to south Florida .

title: Best stories, wildest celebrations from amazing round of qualifiers
content: the break produced a plethora of world cup qualifying drama . tiny nations reached the finals for the first time, last-minute goals produced decisive results and a handful of major names tumbled by the wayside . the break was the last player to score for Scotland at a world cup in 1998 .

title: NHL Bubble Watch: Projecting playoff hopes for all 32 teams
content: no team in the east was more than four points out of the wild-card spot . in the west, all but three teams were within three points of a playoff spot. this month, we're also looking at points of concern early this season for teams inside and outside the bubble.

title: Passan's MLB offseason preview: Every signing or trade we could see this winter
content: the largest free agent contract the Pirates have ever handed out was more than a decade ago . the Pittsburgh Pirates were primed to spend more than twice that on Josh Naylor before he re-upped with Seattle for five years and $92.5 million in the first signing .

title: ‘Reinvention needed’: Investors dump IT stocks slow in AI race; firms struggling to meet client needs
content: Partha, senior assistant editor (markets) at The Times of India, Mumbai, covers the financial markets, mainly the stock market, mutual funds, banking and insurance sectors. He is a sports enthusiast. His hobby is philately. title: What we learned from Duke's win over Kansas at Champions Classic
content: the 15th edition of Champions Classic ended with wins for the Kentucky Wildcats and Duke Blue Devils . the Spartans ran away with a 17-point victory, and the no. 5 blue Devils sealed the 12-point win . ESPN's college basketball reporter Myron Medcalf and NBA draft analyst Jeremy Woo break down what they're taking away from a star-studded night in new york .

title: Anthony Yarde hoping third time's a charm in David Benavidez world title showdown
content: Anthony Yarde was stopped by artur Beterbiev and Sergey Kovalev in 2023 and 2019 respectively . the 34-year-old says he will be better in his third attempt at winning a world light heavyweight title on sunday . he was stopped in eight rounds for three versions of the world title, after lasting 11 rounds .

title: O's acquire Ward from Angels for RHP Rodriguez
content: the Baltimore Orioles acquired outfielder Taylor Ward from the los Angeles Angels in exchange for right-hander Grayson Rodriguez . the pair went into the offseason seeking a top-of-the-rotation starter and hope to get one in Rodriguez, who is entering his final season before free agency . Rodriguez was drafted no. 11 overall out of high school in 2018 and showed promise in his first two big league seasons .
